contents.content1:
654/5=130.4
Step 1:- Multiply the number to 2: 654X2 = 1304

Step 2:- In case of 5, shift the number by 1 decimal point; In case of 50, shift the number by 2 decimal points and so on... i.e. 130.4

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to divide 578 by 50
Step 1:- Multiply the number to 2: 578X2 = 1156

Step 2:- In case of 50, shifting decimal point by 2: 11.56

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to divide 39577 by 500
Step 1:- Multiply the number to 2: 39577X2 = 79154

Step 2:- In case of 500, shifting decimal point by 3: 79.154

topic: Finding Square root of any number

contents.content1:
To find out square root of any number you should know square of numbers from '0 to 9' and their last digit: √1296 = 36
Step 1:- Ignore last 2 digits from the number, and find new number “N”: 1296 = N = 12

Step 2:- Check between 0-9 which number’s square is just less than or equal to this new number “N”. It will be left part of your answer “L”: Square of “3” i.e. “9” is just less than 12. So L = 3

Step 3:- Check between 0-9 which number’s square’s last digit is equal to the last digit of original number. One of those 2 numbers is right part of your answer “R”: Square of 4 i.e. “16” and square of 6 i.e. “36” has last digit as “6”. R = 4/6

Step 4:- Find L*(L+1), If this is less than or equal to “N” than bigger number will be right part of your answer else smaller number: 3*(3+1) = “12” = “N” R= 6

Step 5:- Put both left and right part of answers together: L|R = 3|6 = 36

Note:- If Last digit of number is 0 or 5 than right part of answer will also be “0” or “5”

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to find square root of 2025
Step 1:- :- Ignore last 2 digits from the number, and find new number “N”: 2025 = N = 20

Step 2:-Check between 0-9 which number’s square is just less than or equal to this new number “N”. It will be left part of your answer “L”: Square of “4” i.e. “16” is just less than 20. So L = 4

Step 3:- As last digit of original number is 5 so it will be right part of answer: R=5

Step 4:- Put both left and right part of answers together: L|R = 4|5 = 45

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to find square root of 3844
Step 1:- Ignore last 2 digits from the number, and find new number “N”: 3844 = N = 38

Step 2:- Check between 0-9 which number’s square is just less than or equal to this new number “N”. It will be left part of your answer “L”: Square of “6” i.e. “36” is just less than 38. So L = 6

Step 3:- Check between 0-9 which number’s square’s last digit is equal to the last digit of original number. One of those 2 numbers is right part of your answer “R”: Square of 2 i.e. “4” and square of 8 i.e. “64” has last digit as “4”. R = 2/8

Step 4:- Find L*(L+1), If this is less than or equal to “N” than bigger number will be right part of your answer else smaller number: 6*(6+1) = 42 > “N”; R= 2

Step 5:- Put both left and right part of answers together: L|R = 6|2 = 62

topic: Finding Cube root of any number

contents.content1:
To find out square root of any number you should know cube of numbers from “0 to 9” and their last digit. FYR here is the table for that
Number | Cube | Last digit of Cube
1 1 1
2 8 8
3 27 7
4 64 4
5 125 5
6 216 6
7 343 3
8 512 2
9 729 9
-----------------------------------------------------
3√571787 = 83
Step 1:- Ignore last 3 digits from the number, and find new number “N”: 571787 = N = 571

Step 2:- Check from above table which number’s cube is just less than or equal to this new number “N”. It will be left part of your answer “L”: Cube of “8” i.e. “512” is just less than 571. So L = 8

Step 3:- Check from above table which number’s cube’s last digit is equal to the last digit of original number. That numbers is right part of your answer “R”: Cube of 3 i.e. “27” has last digit as “7”. R = 3

Step 4:- : Put both left and right part of answers together: L|R = 8|3 = 83

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to find cube root of 9261
Step 1:- Ignore last 3 digits from the number, and find new number “N”: 9261 = N = 9

Step 2:- Check from above table which number’s cube is just less than or equal to this new number “N”. It will be left part of your answer “L”: Cube of “2” i.e. “8” is just less than 9. So L = 2

Step 3:- Check from above table which number’s cube’s last digit is equal to the last digit of original number. That numbers is right part of your answer “R”: Cube of 1 i.e. “1” has last digit as “1”. R = 1

Step 4:- Put both left and right part of answers together: L|R = 2|1 = 21

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to find cube root of 117649
Step 1:-Ignore last 3 digits from the number, and find new number “N”: 117649 = N = 117

Step 2:-Check from above table which number’s cube is just less than or equal to this new number “N”. It will be left part of your answer “L”: Cube of “4” i.e. “64” is just less than 117. So L = 4

Step 3:- Check from above table which number’s cube’s last digit is equal to the last digit of original number. That numbers is right part of your answer “R”: Cube of 9 i.e. “729” has last digit as “9”. R = 9

Step 4:- Put both left and right part of answers together: L|R = 4|9 = 49
